j2k

Class JpipDataInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • j2k.JpipDataInputStream

  • public class JpipDataInputStream
extends java.lang.Object
    The class JpipDataInputStream allows to read JPIP data-bin segments, as it is defined in the Part 9 of the the JPEG2000 standard.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Juan Pablo Garcia Ortiz
    See Also:
    InputStream, JpipDataSegment

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructs a object based on the indicated InputStream.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean readSegment(JpipDataSegment segment)
      Reads the next data segment from the stream, adn stores its information in the JpipDataSegment object passed as parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • readSegment

        public boolean readSegment(JpipDataSegment segment)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next data segment from the stream, adn stores its information in the JpipDataSegment object passed as parameter. The data buffer is not reallocated every time. It is only reallocated if the next data length is bigger than the previous one.
        Parameters:
        segment - Object where to store the data.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a new data segment was read, or false if the end of stream was reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
